newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass device market software available.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass device market software available.

text.p: Spyglass Inc said Monday it released its Spyglass Device Mosaic 1.0, a software that requires very little memory and can be used to link devices other than computers to the Internet.
In a related announcement, Spyglass said its Spyglass MicroServer is also available. The MicroServer can be used in office equipment, vending machines and industrial equipment.
Spyglass said Xerox Corp has become the first licensee of the the MicroServer technology. MicroServer allows products such as copy machines to provide diagnostics or data via the Internet.
Spyglass said networking company Network Computing Devices Inc has licensed Device Mosaic for use in its network computers.
Development licenses for Device Mosaic and the MicroServer start at $50,000, Spyglass said.
Spyglass also said it will unveil its Spyglass Prism, which takes content from the World Wide Web and adapts it for non-computer devices.
The announcements are part of Spyglass's move into the "device market", connecting non-computer products and appliances to the Web and each other using the Internet protocol.
"We're making it real with product shipments and with deals," said Randy Pitzer, spokesman for Spyglass.
